description:
So Comstock is officially never going away, right? I can love it unconditionally, right?

Man, this place is like the Burning Man of bars because no matter how many d-bags like myself and other techies and finance bros keep on showing up, the aura and sanctity of the place perseveres.

You're always sure to get either awesome food or amazing drinks. The new chef is good tho I can't help missing Michael Miller. BUT with likes of Che and Eric behind the bar, the drinks will never disappoint. Very welcoming without being TOO nice to SF d-bags like me.

Did I mention they have live music every night and it's not another freakin EDM dj. I mean, I love EDM but I'm a d-bag remember.

Yo Jason! How about a fish dish BRO
author: Farooq N.

description:
People usually come for drinks at the bar or for dinner but Eater's brunch list said this place is great for brunch. Honestly, I was pleasantly surprised! Not one of the best places yet but definitely has potential. 

MUST GET: garlic miso tater tots (amazing! I could eat so many of these.), tres leches french toast (It tastes more like a strawberry short cake than a french toast but it's delicious!) 

DON'T GET: char siu eggs benedict (the breading was way too crunchy and tough and too much bread and not enough char siu)

Best pro is that you can make a reservation for weekend brunch and not wait for hours in the long lines at other brunch restaurants.
author: Rohenne L.

description:
Made a reservation through open table but the restaurant was quite empty for brunch. The most painful thing around North Beach is the availability of street parking. Managed to find one after close to to 30 mins.

My impression/ review of most places breaks down as follows:

Ambience (1/1): nice place, great history. Really liked the huge ceiling fans!
Service (1/1): attentive and quick service, friendly servers 
Food (1/1): Compliments to the chef for some tasty food. I wasn't super impressed by the plating or presentation. But hey! Everything tasted great.
Portion Size (0/1): Typically for brunches since I am substituting two meals for one I expect to be stuffed. Comstock Saloon brunch will not do that for ya! We had three dishes and two drinks and I still have room for desserts ( which was one of the three dishes)
Price (0/1): for the amount of food and the general feeing of not being full, paying $70 seems a tad overpriced. I don't mind the price but not until it allows me to feel that I did sub two meals for one IMO.
author: Ellie P.

description: I've been to Comstock Saloon a few times but it has always been for drinks & appetizers only. Comstock has a classic, old-style feel with solid drinks and yummy appetizers. I was hoping for a warm cocktail since it was cold & windy sitting by the bar but unfortunately they didn't have any warm boozy drinks.. bummer. Still, I enjoyed my Mint Julep cocktail but the Blood & Sand cocktail was a bit too sweet for my taste. As for the appetizers, you must order the White Cheddar Chexx -- they're so addictive! The garlic miso tater tots and the Eggs on Eggs (aka deviled eggs) were also good appetizers to share.
author: Ruby C.

description:
On a Sunday morning, as sun streamed in and passersby peered in, I learned about the history of Comstock Saloon from the friendly servers and manager. It occupies the space of the Andromeda Saloon which opened after the 1906 earthquake. I love the historic photos around the saloon, and the care with which the bar and fixtures were restored. Look for the beautiful ceiling lights and fans.

I came for brunch, due to the Chef's Instagram. They have a variety of offerings; I chose shakshuka. It is a hearty, delicious dish with the nice addition of falafel. Fresh squeezed grapefruit juice is very good. They offer appetizing desserts (ask for those they serve at lunch - not on the menu).

Check out Comstock Saloon, for a view of San Francisco history and good food.
author: Carol W.

description:
3.5 for food 
4 for ambience 

I love the dark old world saloon feel and this place has been around sf for a long time so it feels very classic. It's well known for cocktails so when I came here for dinner I was a bit underwhelmed. 

Deviled eggs best thing we had 
Brussels sprouts were good 
The burger was the smallest entree burger I've ever seen
Cacio e Pepe pasta was also good but not great 

I appreciated being able to get pretty good food last minute on a Saturday night in SF and would love to come here for cocktails any day.
author: Daniela J.

description: Respect this spot. Old time 1900s feels, excellent foods, especially good bar program, and lovely warm service. Pretty big spot so not too much pressure on seating, if you are a walk up, but they do take reservations. We got the oysters, tater tots, egg on egg, 3 lechas, and the bennie. Everything tasted amazing and the presentation was true to what I have heard almost psychedelic. Lots of lovely  touches... defo coming back!
author: A M.

description:
The shakshuka is amazing. The brilliant, innovative synthesis of two middle eastern classics seems so obvious when you taste it. The falafel is fried extra crispy so it's never soggy. The textural contrast between the soft egg dish and the crunchy falafel inside is a pleasant & flavorful surprise. 
The historic design elements combined with innovative twists on classic dishes makes for a timeless ambiance. The building has been a saloon since 1907, and its industrial, Art Deco, bygone personality cannot be ignored. It's a quintessential San Francisco experience to be treasured.
author: Isabel F.

description: Awesome throwback watering hole in the north beach area.  Original fixtures and old timey live music make you feel like you stepped back into the 20's.  The brussel sprouts and burger were amazing!  If you're into history and historic architecture, this is eye candy for days.  Will be back next time I'm in SF!
author: Erin E.

description:
I went here to celebrate a friend's birthday. We ordered a couple of cocktails along with various dishes. First the good: service was excellent, the atmosphere was cool, and the cocktails were good. Now for the not so good: the food was just meh and I felt very overpriced for what we got. We ordered the churros, octopus corn dogs, tartare, chips and dip, and calamari. The best item was the calamari. The mini corn dogs were mostly batter and $14 for three mini corn dogs? 

I would recommend just going to the bar for drinks before having dinner elsewhere.
author: Angelito R.

description:
For upwards of one year now I've been aware of Comstock's free Friday lunch.  What's the catch?  2 "adult" beverages (beers are fine) and it's yours.  

In celebration of Emperor Norton's 200th birthday on a Sunday, Comstock Saloon changed the game a bit:  Free Pork Belly Benedict was on offer with the same catch.  Worth a trip across the City?  I think so.  

Comstock Saloon is a fun place.  

This visit was my first time dining at Comstock though not my first time drinking there.  Drinking, I've always done in the front room which is impeccably old-timey but not quite as much so as the attached room behind it.  Both feature excellent bartenders who'll stir up visions of SF's Barbary Coast days in both grooming and dress.  It's authentic, not kitschy, and appropriate when you realize that they're plying their trade in San Francisco's second oldest bar.  

The back room is where you'll find the original "air conditioner" which needs to be seen rather than described.  Everything about the place seems from another (better?) time though in a way that works for today.  If you're a visitor to SF, this is a good bar from which to enjoy a taste of the City's past.   

If there's anywhere to celebrate old SF the Comstock is it and they were in full swing for this historic occasion.  I counted no less than 4 Emperor Nortons present and drinking as well as a host of women in old Victorian garb doing the same.   The food though, that's all 2018.

The free Pork Belly Benedict turned out to be more like a half order as I've never known Benedict to cover only 50% of an English Muffin or be served with only 1 egg.  It was good, but maybe a bit of deceptive advertising.  

A burger ($15) was excellent even if it was served without fries (an extra $7, ouch).  The menu promised Malt Vinegar Chips but my server warned that they were on the burger, not beside it, and even though I wished for a burger with traditional sides I admit: this was a filling and delicious burger, perfect to sop up the alcohol you'll want to consume here.  

Cocktails are executed to perfection.  A Pisco Punch ($13) was man enough to confirm that I ought not have a second, even if it meant missing out on the free lunch.  Ditto on the Manhattan ($11).  Comstock Saloon also has Happy Hour deals which, despite the free lunch offering, might be a better value proposition.  

I'll happily return for a stiff cocktail, a delicious burger, and a sample of San Francisco's history.  Oh, if those walls could talk...
author: Tracey A.

description: After passing this fun spot a few times, I finally brought a Bumble date here and I'm glad I did! We had a great time! Make sure and check the online schedule or call ahead to find out if there is going to be live music that night or not. There was the night we showed up and it was a good show. But, it will be loud so figure out what will work best for you. Lively and loud or low key and intimate-whichever will fit your date needs best!
author: Andrea R.

description:
After coming here from a recommendation by a friend, I am sad to say I was really disappointed from my experience. I give the place points for getting me and my boyfriend our drinks quickly and a unique atmosphere, but the bartenders here are just plain rude. 

After taking the payment for our drinks (I paid cash, boyfriend paid with card), the bartender disappeared to the back for 10 minutes. My boyfriend and I started to wonder where our change/card was so we asked another bartender who was standing by if we could get our change/card. The bartender sarcastically replied, "Looks like you haven't even finished your drink but sure, I'll go find the other bartender". That was a little offsetting but we didn't say anything to him 

Once the original bartender returned, my boyfriend asked if everything went alright with the card (remind you he had been gone 10 minutes with it) and the bartender looked like we had said something bad and replied defensively and harshly that he was busy relieving a coworker? Ok no problem. My boyfriend replied, "Oh ok sorry I just get paranoid sometimes when my card is missing for a long time". The bartender replied, even more defensively, "Why? Why would I do something with your card?", rolled his eyes and finally gave us my cash and his card.

When I received my change, he shorted me and I was too intimidated and didn't say anything because I didn't want to cause even more drama. We chugged our drinks (which weren't amazing tbh) and got out of there as quickly as we could. 

I hate leaving bad reviews but this just dampened the rest of the night and put us in bad moods. As someone who works in customer service, I would never give a paying customer an attitude like that. 1/10 would not recommend.
author: Anissa R.

description: I've been coming here since I was a kid - even when it was SF Brewing company. Was there last week and got good service except the server (Cortnie) added on a tip I'm certain I did not put on the receipt. I tipped 20% and she added another $2. I took a picture of the original receipt as I always do for my phone (because this happened to me once before - but with a much larger amount). I don't care about the $2 but I do mind being cheated from a server I was generous with. Very disheartening.
author: Sasha B.

description:
Lovely bar, especially on the weekend with the live jazz.

The variety on the menu was interesting although we only came in for appetizers and drinks. The shishito peppers were to die for! The waiter recommended some delicious drinks for everyone and we enjoyed the live music very much.

We will definitely be returning on our next trip back to SF.
author: Sara A.

description:
Old school saloon feel with great cocktails and elevated pub food. Both the burger and homemade sausage are off the chain. Live music playing from upstairs. 

Great place to take a date or out of towners.
author: Eric N.

description:
Brunch today- food and service pretty much a fail. We ordered 2 eggs benedict, french toast, Ferry building salad. Portions were really small, 1 piece of toast/eggs for Benedict. Can we at least have the second piece of bread to match the yolk. Benedicts were also cold, everything overly salty and really slow to arrive. Not to mention, we never got the fries we ordered. No server/manager follow up, but the manager did manage to stop by to complian about us playing with the salt shaker. 
Save your money and your time. There at least 100 other restaurants in this area that serve great food, better price and superior service.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Any bar that has live music is a hit in my books! Live jazz - yes, please! They're on the 2nd floor, so everyone has a good view.

I only had one drink here and they did it extremely well - the Manhattan. Good bourbon & cherries. Stiff, just the way I like 'em. 

Love the atmosphere here. The band is loud enough where you can enjoy the music, but not overbearingly loud that you can't hear your company. Also, they attract a pleasant crowd. Everyone is super friendly, definitely no ratchets (lol). I actually preferred sitting at the bar here to feel more of the speakeasy-ish vibe.

I'd come back here in the near future! :)
author: Vee B.

description: Chae our bartender was fantastic. Great service and he fave us advice on all his favorite bars that were wort our time. Also, their 'Staff Meal' food special was a perfect snack.
author: Natalie W.

description:
There's a white waitress who goes by the name "Brianna". who knows if she was telling the truth since the underlying fear in her eyes didn't match the confidence she had when making her petty little comment after my friend accidentally had spilled her Pimms cup. She said "sorry we don't have any sippy cups so you'll have to be careful" which is ironic enough to imply that someone is a child after portraying childish behavior yourself. Also without initiating a friendly hostess vibe to begin with. Yawn. Completely unprofessional and overall embarrassing but I guess if you're a white person in North Beach you can get away with saying literally anything to people of color. I will say that the cocktails tasted incredible and the manager handled the situation to the best of his ability but I feel like the scenario should be brought to light just to warn my allies of the lack of safety you'll receive in this environment. Thank you xoxo

P.S. Brianna you're cancelled boo better luck next time colonialist
author: Ines M.

description:
Come here for the cocktails, stay for the live music. Both were great - the setting provides a fairly unique SF vibe, as the decor is primarily original/refurbished artifacts.

Drink service was fairly slow, but the taste made up for it. The food is pretty good (four stars) but the price raises eyebrows in some cases ($18 for cacio e pepe? Burger comes on a plate with no sides?).

Would definitely go back.
author: Katherine N.

description:
Went here for after dinner drinks with a friend. It's a classy feel and the live jazz was a nice bonus. It was packed on a Friday night but a nice wait staff saw that we were waiting and got us a table. We had the trader vic's mai tai and the south side which were both fantastic. 
Will definitely try again.
author: P K.

description: I'm a fan. I got a beer, burger, and fries. The fries were well seasoned and had a good crisp. The burger was delicious - one of the best burgers I've had in a long time. The meat was marinated in some type of sauce, which separated it from a lot of burgers that just pile things on top of the burger for taste. Service was friendly and attentive.
author: Annie L.

description:
#7

Such a weird night, but a cool bar. 

Place was hella crowded when we walked in.  We found a spot at the bar and they gave us these cool leather drink menus.  I was kinda hungry too, so they gave us a food menu.

We ordered some drinks--scotch and bourbon, and then some artichoke dip.

Drinks: strong
Dip: small

My friends said they didn't want to eat anything, not hungry, but I knew it was because the dip was so small.  Like, my cat wouldn't have gotten full on that tiny little plate, BUT, it tasted great.

As we were enjoying each other, this ginger headed weirdo came over and put his arm around me, touched my friend and starts talking about some really weird stuff--not the bar's fault, but we did tell the guy at the front and he just kinda let the guy bother some other people too.  That's' the ONLY reason I deduct one star.  Not the guy, but the staff not handling it.  I wanted to drink in peace.

Live jazz band was cool too.  Good vibe, great night.
author: Stephani M.

description: What a great little gem. There was a live pianist upstairs and the customer service was on point. The drinks were also out of this world. They are strong; 1 or 2 will get you feeling real good real fast.
author: Tyler S.

description:
The "loft band" was way too noisy to carry on a conversation. You need to sit in the entry room to dodge the loud band!
What makes it worse are the people having to yell and laugh louder than usual!
author: Hershel L.

description:
I've never written a Yelp review- until now. I feel it necessary to write after last's night's negative experience at Comstock Saloon. 

A friend recommended Comstock to us; and our initial impressions weren't bad (the drinks are overpriced, but the bar's interior and ambiance are nice).

However, when it came time to pay, our bartender disappeared to the back of the bar with my credit card and my girlfriend's $20 bill for 10-15 minutes. Like any individual who has his/her credit card disappear, I became a tad worried. We politely asked another bartender to track the original bartender down. But he remarked "you haven't even finished your drink, but sure, I'll track him down" in a snarky and condescending tone. It was an offsetting comment, but we let it slide because we were getting concerned about the whereabouts of our card and money. 

The original bartender finally came out, short-changed my girlfriend, and was combative and rude. He was offended that I would suggest foul play on his part, when all he had to say was "my bad" or "I'm sorry." It appeared as if he went out of his way to be argumentative with me about it and made us feel very uncomfortable. 

My girlfriend and I then chugged our drinks and left: ending what was a great night on a sour tone. The "Saloon experience" was bizarre, off-putting, and demeaning. Maybe Comstock is trying to become the SF version of Dick's Last Resort (the Las Vegas restaurant where gruff staffers purposely insult customers)? But at least there the drinks are good.
author: Jared S.

description: Always a great place to stop for a drink. Whenever I'm in the fidi/north beach area this the place for great music, drinks, and vibes. A very classic San Francisco bar with live music! Happy hour on Saturdays too!
author: Cara M.

description: So we went here because it was reviewed by Anthony Bourdain. We weren't wowed. The service was slow. Our server, though nice, was very chatty and we were trying to have a dinner with friends so that sort of gets in the way. Her recommendations were on point though. And overall the food was very good.
author: Cricket M.

description:
I was supposed to celebrate my 21st birthday here but I got dumped right before BUT I have finally checked this place out six years later as I am never in North Beach. 

Came here once after dinner at Don Ricketts across the street and it was packed on a Friday night. Luckily there is high turnover and easy to get a seat. The drinks were strong and the crowd was friendly. I noticed they had basically a full restaurant type set up in the next room so I ended up making reservations and coming here for dinner. 

Dinner was AMAZINGGGG. They have a small menu but everything we ordered was delicious and portions were huge. It was surprisingly kind of dead on a Sunday night, I kind of imagined this place as always packed to the brim. We got the calamari, bbq chips and ranch, peppers, burger, and brussel sprouts. This was enough for four people and we had leftovers. 

Love the booth seating and live music. Service could be a little better because we never got our water refilled despite it being near empty while we ate but otherwise everything is great. Their drinks are very strong and I did not see anything remotely girly on their cocktail menu so be prepared for that if you usually drink sugary cocktails. They don't mess around here.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Comstock looks like a tourist trap from the outside, especially as it's along the busy Columbus corridor right between North Beach and FiDi, but there's a lot worth discovering inside. 

They have a good cocktail, wine, beer, and spirits selection to begin with, and their happy hour shot & beer combos are humorously quirky. The Boot to the Head, for example, consists of a simple glass of Anchor Steam complimented with a shot of Four Roses bourbon which comes in the most adorable boot-shaped shot glass. Meanwhile, the Kopstoje combines a glass of Trumer Pils with a shot of Bols genever, which, in old-school saloon style, you're supposed to down all while bending over the bar with one arm behind your back. 

Their food offerings are quite decent too, and all of them are reasonably priced, at least by Bay Area standards. Someone else at the bar was feasting on what looked like quite the sumptuous burger, while in my case I tried to look a bit more health-conscious by going for a delicious falafel platter.

Service from the bartender was quite engaging and obliging, and there are several portions to the venue. Best of all, they offer live jazz every night. Definitely more than meets the eye here, and worth a stop for drinks, light bites, and good music.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Great little date night spot! You can tell this place just exudes history. 

Decent sized San Franciscan institution. The bar area was especially great because it had enough seating to make the feeling intimate but large enough to people watch.

I enjoyed my glass of vino here! While it does get quite toasty inside, I think next time I'll opt for a chillier cocktail.

The waitress during the night I visited had some sass to her as she went about her rounds and made small talk with the patrons. 

This is a classy establishment so come dressed to impress (your date).
author: Connie M.

description:
Excellent food AND excellent service! Definitely recommend!

Frequent water refills. 

Quick food delivery. 

Great atmosphere.
author: David C.

description:
After driving around SF deciding on where to grab a bite, I am SO glad I stumbled upon Comstock. 

When we walked in, it was crazy busy, and we were still greeted instantly and immediately seated. The man who seated us was so awesome. He was super nice and when we had a question about the menu (which kind of fruit was on the beet salad, which is apparently a pineapple-guava), he was super helpful and informative. 

The menu was a little limited, especially for a vegetarian. It looked like they took a few menu items off for the night because the one we were given was different than the one outside of the restaurant. We ended up ordering the brussels sprouts, beet salad, oysters, and the falafel balls. LOVED everything, especially their oysters! Only complaint is that the falafel balls tasted like cinnamon, which was a little strange. The tzaziki and cauliflower it came with were delicious though. 

I was seriously amazed how awesome the service was here. This place was filled with people and we still had about 3 people checking in on us, making sure our drinks were filled and to see if we needed anything.

The best part? The music!!! They had a live band playing in a room above that overlooks the restaurant. The band was great and it was so cool to have a show while we were eating dinner. 

ABSOLUTELY will be returning!
author: Audrey M.

description:
Came here while waiting for our table at Z & Y lounge (check out my review for that). 

Nice ambiance, good drinks, and nice service. Also ordered the brussel sprouts which we all enjoyed thoroughly. 

One big piece of feedback is that its confusing how seating at the bar works. There's two places you can enter and when we wanted a night cap after dinner, we grabbed an open high top table in the bar area and after waiting for about 10 mins to get served, we were told that there is a wait list to get seated at the bar and that we had to move. We ended up leaving at the point. Most other places have "first come first serve" at the bar so this isn't clear and left a bad taste in our mouths.
author: Laura D.

description:
I'll admit I've been lazy with writing reviews the past year or so.  Of the many places I've been to during this time the Comstock Saloon is the one I most regret not taking the time to write about.  I've been there enough where should have probably written about it while I sat at the bar. Problem is the conversations with the bar and waitstaff always seem to get in the way. Add a pile of drinks to that and you have someone who's way too happy to be writing a review. 

When I went to write this review I didn't know what I liked better here.  Was it the cocktails that are perfectly made every time? Or was it the food that is surprisingly better than expected for a place that seems to be focused on being a bar. Then I thought to myself what the hell does "saloon" mean anyway. The definition is a public room or building used for a specified purpose. Well I asked myself, what is its purpose? It's purpose I learned one Friday morning there is simply enjoyment. You cannot come here and not enjoy something. Whether it's the amazing food coming out of their tiny kitchen, the step back into time feel, or the history of cocktail making behind the bar something will make you enjoy your time here and make you want to come back. For years I used to come up Columbus and walk into Vesuvio's and never leave but now I glance right by and smile at my old friend of a bar knowing my new home in North Beach is now the Comstock Saloon.
author: Joco F.

description:
Happy Hour Special: whiskey bourbon and a short Anchor Steam ($12). My girlfriend had the drink. It was great, I know it had citrus in it, maybe some ginger and bourbon. Whatever it was--it was great ($7).

My girlfriend and I were going to a show shortly after, so we didn't want to load I want food. But the fries looked great, and so are the chips. 

The food is (mostly) priced fair. A couple things are ambitious, like their $17 hamburger. But most of the small and medium-size plates are between $7 and $12

The staff here was great too. Very real people, but  everybody was on top of their game. 

It's nice to see a local swanky pub in San Francisco. Had a great time. Would totally come back.
author: Dave K.

description: Almost everything was perfect here, the atmosphere and decor of the bar was really cool. The live jazz band helped make the evening. The food, well it was just sardine! I had the eggs on eggs and the burger, and that burger is hands down the best I've ever had. Any time I'm in the city this will be a new goto spot!
author: Kevin D.

description:
My favorite place. Service is great- laid back, but attentive. Drinks are spot on (I like to have the bartender be creative with my martinis) and strong.  You can't beat the atmosphere- great mood lighting, cozy booths.  The music starts around 8pm and is a fun jazzy vibe- band is up in the rafters.
Food is awesome. Had the Brussels sprouts, cheeseburger and fries last night. 

Highly recommend!
author: Katie O.

description: Unique place. Don't come here for beers though, this place is about other drinks and atmosphere. Also, you kind of got to like jazz or similar music. So western type of setup with live jazz... a unique place like I said.
author: Gil S.

description:
I was about to give them 3 stars but my eife convienced me to raise it to 4...
The place has a very neat old world decor.
(Its all original / restored from 1906).
They are no equipped for large parties but they did managed to creat a spot from a few tables for a group of 7 of us.
The scotch selection is standard nothing special 
Classic american bar selection... simillar to a sports bar.
There was a live band music (jazz playing) in my opinion too loudly you couldnt talk to much had to yell lol.
But if you adore jazz it a good hang out.
I checked the yelp photos of the food before we came and i got a bit disappointed when i wanted to order since many of the dishes i was planing to order was no longer in the menu apperetly its was changed and downsized...
The black cavier dish they had was good but a bit to much cream and not enough caviar.

I will give them a firm congratulations on making one of the best burgers i had in a bar ever.
Wow so juciy and well made.
author: Evgene L.

description: For a quirky and historic restaurant, I was disenchanted with the food. I went for brunch this past Sunday with a friend and we shared the shrimp and grits and tres leches French toast. Despite the fact we each ordered and wanted to share, the dishes came about 15 mins apart from each other, and were not worth the wait. The shrimp and grits was flavorful, but came with two whole fried shell-on shrimp on top that were very messy to de-shell and eat. See picture with this review. That was frustrating to have to prepare my own food after it was served. I would have much preferred two de-shelled or tail-on only shrimp that I could use my utensils to eat. In regards to the French toast, it was very flavorful, but unfortunately burned on the entire bottom. The whipped white chocolate Chantilly cream was very heavy and melting before it even reached our table. Personally, I would not recommend this restaurant for brunch as there are other places in North Beach with better foodservice.
author: Lauren C.

description: Went to this place for a quick bite before going to a theater experience for the evening.  While the attitude of some of the staff left something to be desired the food came out quickly and was absolutely delicious!  Best burger I've had in quite some time!  We will definitely make another visit to this place!
author: Kristin S.

description: It's hipster, it's packed, it's exactly what you expect it to be. Wait times at the bar can get long, and the upstairs bar/lounge area generally has a large number of its tables reserved, so you might be settling for the few seats at the bar or standing room only. However, drinks are strong here, so you'll get the most bang for your buck, and you'll feel like you've been transported back in time with the 1920s/30s decor. Now, if only they would speak to you in old English, you would have the whole experience.
author: Danny C.

description: These guys pour an amazing Manhattan.  The bar has history, with lots of original features.  The staff is great and it's always a great time.
author: Quinn B.

description:
Such a cool bar! They have live music every night of the week AND no cover! 

The bar has a very speakeasy vibe and the bartenders are fantastic and professional. 

Recommend sitting at the bar and seeing everything in action
author: Paul D.

description:
I love places where the bartenders can craft you a cocktail based on what you are feeling that day. At Combstock, it's the Barkeep's Whimsy option. I said I wanted fruity, sweet and I like mojitos and the bartender made me just that. At $13 a drink, it is pretty costly, but it's a good splurge once in a while when they make it well. This place also has a dimly lit atmosphere and live jazz playing which is cool.

Overall, chill place to listen to music, hang out and grab a drink of your choice.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
I can only speak for the drinks here, but WOW... these bartenders know how to make the best gin fizz I've had in SF. It's an art and they have certainly mastered it.

Note to other bars in SF: learn to do whatever Comstock does for the gin fizz!
author: Emmy Q.

description: Phenomenal cocktails and live music in a fun atmosphere. Great service and ambiance! Didn't eat so can't speak to the food but was an awesome place for a night cap!
author: Heidi G.

description: Down and dirty bar. The Bartenders are cool and they make a great drink.  I cant think of anything I would expect more from a cool City Bar. Great vibe as there is plenty of action going on. Business deals being made, First dates and girls night out. I love it , they have it all.
author: Manny G.

description: Good food, average seating (booths were pretty comfortable, chairs at least had padding). Service was inattentive but friendly. Prices average for area
author: Shannon D.

description: Came by here for dinner and drinks with work colleagues. The venue is very cool and old school. They had a band on the balcony adding to the ambiance. The drinks were a solid 5 out of 5. Really well done. The food was good, tried the burger which was solid too. The service was hit or miss, but wasn't a huge issue.
author: Jonah K.

description:
So impressed with this place--its ambiance, service and drinks! As it was a short walk from Cotogna, we decided to have our post-dinner drinks here and we were not disappointed. 

If you want to get a booth, a chaise or a high top table, you'll have to ask the hostess for assistance. All the tables were occupied when we got there, but we didn't wait long to get a high top table in their smaller (but brighter) room. Check out both rooms as they have lots of vintage details that they've preserved! 

Carrying on with the evening's Italian theme, I ordered an Americano (it's Negroni week!). I needed something less boozy as I needed to drive  us home. I've also started a love affair with Campari this past year, and I've come to appreciate that signature bitter flavor. My husband had a glass of Prosecco which is good for any occasion! 

Everyone was really friendly here, from the hostess to the servers, to the bartender. Great place to people watch too from their corner bar! They didn't have live music yet, but it sure is another good reason to come here.
author: Hazel C.

description: The Chicken Roulade was delicious! The broccoli Romanesco and capers balanced the dish perfectly. The Broccoli was seasoned well and cooked to perfection. I kept going in for more Romanesco. The chicken had a little pink on the inside but didn't lool raw. Prices for lunch are over $20 but worth it on a Friday. The Brussel Sprouts were also very good as an appetizer.
author: Kam H.

description: Everything about this place is great. From the live music upstairs, the bartenders, and the actual cocktails themselves, this place is top notch. I ordered a Sazerac, and it was like I was back in NOLA at the Sazerac bar. I love going to a cocktail bar and the bartenders are the real deal. From the outfits, to the shakes, this place is the real deal. Terrific spot.
author: Nick D.

description:
Went around 4pm to celebrate a friend's 21st birthday and our waiter was very nice and helpful! He asked my friend what she would like in a drink and brought out a Pisco Punch for her. He even gave a little description about the history of the drink and how it actually originated in SF! I got the Tom Collins which was great as well. 

It's a really nice space, there's sort of a darker back room that has a longer bar area, and the front room, where we were, had more sunlight and a smaller bar. 

I noticed they also had a good food menu but we had dinner plans later and did not indulge. A really nice place to get a drink overall!
author: Isabel C.

description:
I came here in a group of five on Monday night.

Food: We only came here for drinks after dinner, so we didn't initially order anything, but we ended up getting an appetizer order of fries, per our waitress's recommendation. The fries was super salty and had a lot of spices on them, but the Miller ranch sauce was incredible!! Portions on the fries weren't huge, but decent for a parties of 3-4. 

Drinks: The 5 of us all ordered off the cocktail menu on the first page. None of us really enjoyed our drink a ton. One tasted like straight lemonade, one straight mint, one straight scorch, one straight bourbon, and mine (Greenbriar cocktail) tasted like straight water (I'm not an alcoholic I promise). A couple of us got another drink (no cocktails this time) but I refrained. Next time, I think I would order a specific drink from their very diverse selection of liquors to see if those are any better. They don't really have an extensive beer selection.

Atmosphere: The ambiance of the place is the real reason to come here. It's dimly lit with spacious (room for 6) seating in semi-private booths divided so you can't see behind you). There was a jazz ensemble playing some easy jazz on the 2nd floor balcony. They came around after a set to collect tips but were super courteous about it. In our case, he came to our table about 2 minutes after we had sat down and asked if we had just arrived (we were all looking at menus). 

Service: The waitress was attentive, even going so far as to admitting to her confusion after we switched the seating order (which changed the drink order) on her. She was quick and aware. All the staff was dressed professionally in black and the bartenders had ties on. 

This would be a good place to come on an upscale date or in a small group for a drink or two, but don't expect to grab a casual beer here.
author: Jacob R.

description: love that this place has enough seating for 10 -- great for people watching and getting some light on a sunny day even if there is no outdoor seating. Great waitress even split our entire bill and didn't give attitude about it! Great happy hour--special drinks, all cocktails were wonderful; well selected list of beers and wines. will definitely come back sometime soon, hopefully for their buy two cocktails get your lunch free on Fridays. :)
author: Sleepy B.

description:
Came here for a drink after dinner the other night and was very impressed. The place is like an old time saloon, and features live jazz music and old fashioned drinks. Loved the feel of the place and overall ambiance. The menu was super old looking with faded pages that were hard to read - which i guess adds to the mystery. The cocktail list was fun, with ingredients like "secrets." 

I had the Pisco Punch (I think that's what it was called, the words were so faded) but it was really good. So smooth, and a great combination of flavors. I'll definitely be coming back here next time I'm in the area.
author: Sara S.

description: cant review the food here, but the bartender and craft cocktails are superb! ask him to make something up (bar tenders choice) and stand back to watch the magic happen! crowded place - you'll have to wangle to get a seat.
author: Matthew B.

description:
8:30pm-9:30pm: I have never been shoved by a waitress before but tonight was the first. She shoved me so hard I almost fell. Not a great way to start the evening. Anyway we couldn't be served upstairs because it was reserved for a party (understandable). We went to the other side and sat at a table and she ended up being our waitress so I confronted her. I told her she shoved me really hard and almost knocked me over and she said she was sorry but she is busy with so much attitude. I told her she should really say excuse me instead of shoving people; being busy is no excuse to not have manners. She got upset and walked away. I'm glad she didn't service us, definitely didn't want someone who lacked the basic skills to handle customers. To make things even worse she went back to her fellow coworkers to talk about the situation where we all can see her/hear her. Whoever manages this place should really make her work in the back where she doesn't deal with customer interaction. I have never received so much attitude from a waitress. At least pretend to be genuine when saying sorry. I have worked in a bar/restaurant and I get that it gets busy but I have the basic skills in communicating if I needed to get through people. To wrap up this review I'm giving it two stars because:
1. She didn't serve us
2. Our other server was super nice
author: Rikki K.

description:
Great food (burger and oysters) even better cocktails (get a sazerac).

One of the only places that has live (good) jazz every night of the week.

Perfect spot.
author: Nathan M.

description: Had a feeling I should stop by and happy I did. This place is quality service and old school experience. Live jazz
author: andrew r.

description:
I really like coming to this spot just to enjoy the decor and atmosphere. It's dimely lit and there's usually a live band playing. It's a great place for drinks and food and not too crowded since I've been visiting. There are two entrances and we usually like to go to the one a little further down and sit right next to the entrance. I've ordered the food a few times but what keeps me going back are the drinks. I usually get the Cherry Bounce because anything cherries is awesome.

Definitely recommend hitting up this place if you're in the city.
author: Camera P.

description:
Comstock Saloon has long been on my list of places to visit, either for the adult beverages, the food, or both.  On this cold, wintry night, my friends and I popped in after dinner for a libation or two, or three.  The place wasn't too crowded and we were lucky to nab one of the booths.  It afforded us a full view of the band playing upstairs and allowed us to see and be seen in the bar area.

The cocktail menu is limited but for $13 they will make you pretty much any cocktail of your choice.  Even if you are ordering something from the past, the bartender will provide a very well made version of it.  No cheap mixers to be found here!  They beverage menu includes a small list of interesting cocktails and a few standard ones.

We loved the ambiance, which had an eclectic, old fashioned San Francisco vibe.  The place was pretty relaxed and folks seemed to all want to have a great time.  The host (?) was fantastic!

Parking is not an issue as there are plenty of garages and street parking nearby.

I cannot wait to return to try the food.
author: Melissa L.

description:
Best Manhattan you'll ever order. 

Also, you probably should order the Brussel sprouts
author: Max M.

description:
Day drinking has been more desirable to me lately than at happy hour with all the crowds. 

I like being able to go to Comstock Saloon during the day where everything is nice and quite. The staff can attend to your needs. The service is a lot quicker. Also, plenty of seating so no worries about being close proximity with other patron. 

We ordered:

South Side = Gin, lemon, and mint. Refreshing and tangy. 

Cheery Bounce = Bourbon, cherry brandy, champagne, and lemon. One of their popular drinks!

Hendrick's = with a twist.

Overall, I like this place and the ambiance. I hope you give these tasty cocktails a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description: Martini was all I got and it was all I needed. Fantastic drink and service. The bartender knew what he was doing and knew how to talk to people. Would love to come back and drink more and more and more.
author: Conor S.

description:
Drinks are fun here. I love the pisco punch which tastes like a lemon drop. Good amount of alcohol in the mixed drinks, which has given me plenty of excellent Saturday nights I can't remember. 

Music is AWESOME - they have live music, which consists of a singer and some other instrument (guitar, piano, switches up). Their covers are amazing - Adele, and other top 40s songs, etc. But the covers they do are acoustic and have a jazzy touch - so classy. My only complaint is that they're performing on the 2nd floor, which you can't really see from the ground floor (2nd floor is not accessible for customers, just for performers). I wish I could see the faces of the entertainment, but oh well, it's still excellent music. 

They have lots of booths, and also smaller table tops for 2, which can accommodate great for groups of 4-6, and smaller tables for a romantic night with your significant other. I've been here several times and always have a great time!
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Awesome place for a Friday night. The eggs Benedict was amazing and the fried calamari was to die for.
author: Brett T.

description:
So when we (me & Vicky L) made a plan to catch up with the awesome Dorothy Y, she suggested this bar as our rendezvous. It wasn't too crowded when we arrived and we were able to find 3 spots together at the bar. 

The bartender was speedy and professional and our cocktails were tasty. I had the cherry bounce and it was lovely. My friends got other drinks that they definitely enjoyed.

The ambiance is heavy on the wood which makes for a very cozy experience. 

As it started to get really crowded with the supper crowd we moved on, giving our seats up to some very grateful new patrons.
author: Jen L.

description:
It really does feel good on the mouth!

Great drinks and creative eats.  Unicorn tuna tartare, brussels sprouts, cheddar chexx, octopus corn dogs - all awesome.

Everything cooks quickly, and most dishes are filled with edible greens from unique sources - yum.

The place has serious Barbary Coast roots and the staff smile a lot :)
author: Eric R.

description:
Delicious dinner at a 100 year old saloon!
We had the half a roasted chicken, with greens and cashew  nuts. Fantastic and well presented!
author: Linda V.

description:
Been here probably 5 times now and always have a great time. I haven't had a chance to try the food yet but i'm sure it is just as great as the drinks.

The service is always spot on, the bartenders are super friendly and welcoming and always want to make sure you are happy with your drink. 

Also usually pretty busy on weeknights (only time I have ever been here), not sure about the weekends but I'm sure it's a great time then too.
author: Ilana B.

description: There are many bar options in North Beach/Chinatown, but this is not a dive bar nor a Grant Street Bro Bar. It's a place to order a drink and have a conversation.
author: David F.

description: I loved this place! Went here twice while in town on business. Both times I got excellent cocktails and the first time I had the exceptional burger - don't miss it. Just like my dad used to make on the grill, and the pimento cheese was the perfect compliment.
author: William P.

description: Death by Boilermakers. Really though. Happy Hour is a must if you're in town! Everyday 4p-6p. Staff is friendly and you'll want to stick around for round 2 (and maybe 3 or 4...)
author: Dain M.

description:
The South Side is so much deliciousness in such a simple cocktail. Three orders later... Thank you so much for making my night. Another cocktail was forgettable, but I think that's a matter of taste, not a recipe flaw. 

In addition, great crowd, lyrical music, and fun bartenders.
author: Paulina F.

description: One of the best meals I've had in a long time and unexpected. Brussel sprouts and ribs were standouts.
author: Andrew B.

description:
I had really high expectations for Comstock Saloon but was disappointed by our experience here this past weekend. A and I wanted to spend our evening in North Beach but didn't want Italian food so, after talking about going to Comstock for a while, decided to give it a try. I made a reservation on Open Table (do it or you will wait 5ever) and luckily, they had our table ready early since we were STARVING since we usually eat at 6. Comstock has an interesting setup with 2 bars/in different rooms. The longer room where the host stand has a second floor where live musing was playing overlooking the diners. We were sat in the back corner of the wider room near the kitchen. This space was cozy though we constantly felt a draft from the door opening and closing. Our host asked if we had been there before and gave us suggestions to order both the Fried Brussels Sprouts and Fisherman's Roll which was a nice touch.

I really was excited to try their drinks and had plans to have two during the course of dinner since I couldn't decide on which to drink. I started with the Barkeep's Whimsy ($13) which allows the bartender to basically run wild and create a drink. The waitress asked for my likes and dislikes, the only of which I said I didn't like Whiskey. Not very helpful, I know, but I will try most anything else. A ordered a Manhattan since he is boring or "classic" as he likes to say. We probably waited about 10-15 minutes for our drinks which was fine since the bar was busy and there was only bartender. Most of Comstock Saloon's drinks are also labor intensive so extra time is expected. While we were waiting for our drinks, we ordered food. Now, both of us were really hungry so we got an appetizer in addition to our main courses. Shortly thereafter, our drinks came and I was pretty unhappy with what I was served. I don't even know what it was as our waiter just set them down without any explanation to what the bartender had made for me. It was really sour and had what we think is tequila and grapefruit. I was not a fan and was puckering the whole time I drank it. A's Manhattan was fine, an average Manhattan for sure. It was after our first tastes we decided we would not have 2 drinks here as originally planned.

We ate:

-Fried Brussels Sprouts ($9): SO GOOD. Easily the best Brussels Sprouts ever. Thanks to the host for the recommendation! There was nothing healthy about these but they were a perfect appetizer. I wish I had ordered 2 for my main dish.
-Fisherman's Roll ($18): My order which came with a side of fries. I was not a fan of the overall sandwich and was not expecting Shrimp/Mayo salad. I really don't love chicken salad or anything similar so I wasn't too happy with this. The fries were great though and not too greasy.
-Comstock Burger ($17): This was my boyfriend's order and I wish I had gotten it. The burger was juicy and delicious. The fries were the same as mine.

The food was good, especially the brussels sprouts, but I feel like there are SO many places in the city with similar food and a similar ambience that it doesn't make sense for us to trek all the way up to North Beach. The drinks were underwhelming and, especially in that neighborhood, there are SO many good places to get a drink. I just can't picture us coming back.
author: Carrie W.

description:
Maybe it's my own fault for not knowing how Comstock Saloon "works," but we came in on a Friday night for pre-dinner drinks. We were originally planning to sit at the bar, but all the stools were taken, so we sort of stood around awkwardly waiting to see if a table would open up, as did six others who were in the bar area with us. We didn't see waitstaff for nearly ten whole minutes--and actually I wasn't sure at first that there were any.

Eventually two tables in the back opened up. Four of the girls took one table, and my husband and I took the other. About two minutes after this a server finally came out and without even making eye contact said, "uh, we have a waiting list for these tables." And then walked away. No, "would you like to get ON the list?" or letting us know where we should go/should have gone to get actual service, a polite attitude, nothing.

On our way back out, we noticed the last two people who had been waiting with us had just ordered at the bar and were now just standing around near the doorway with their drinks. So, I might come back because I've heard the cocktails are excellent, but that was a pretty awful first impression. Obviously we weren't the only ones who didn't "get" what we were supposed to be doing.
author: Amanda P.

description: Nice old bar to get a drink while walking around the North Beach area. The make good craft cocktails.
author: Jon M.

description: Cute little bar with a lot of speakeasy vibes. The bar area is as good as the sit down section. The jazz music adds more richness to this trendy place. And service was top notch!
author: The S.

description: Came here on a Friday night expecting this place to be packed. My friend and i both got a drink from the cocktail menu and they were both disappointing. At $13 a drink, which is not cheap, i would expect much more than that. It literally tasted like a cheap well drink with some hard liquor and juice in it. There were no complexity in the flavor.
author: Cindy H.

description:
Very limited selection of the cocktail. I asked for daiquiri or Caribou Lou at that time, and they had a hard time understanding what I was saying. the host sounded like making fun of me, like those things never existed in the bar before. After I told them how to make, and the host just said they don't have the Bacardi and Malibu as the ingredients. Srly...that's quite unacceptable as I believe those are common liquor that will be used to make cocktails.

Everything after Happy hour are quite pricey, make sure you have to come before 6.
author: Natasha L.

description: Nice ambiance and awesome live music! I asked for something fruity and slightly sour and my drink was spot on (maybe a tad too strong but hey ho!) Great service too! I'll definitely come back
author: Weko T.

description: Maybe the greatest bar I've ever been to in my life and maybe the greatest ribs I've ever tasted in my life this is maybe the greatest spot in the entire planet
author: Frank W.

description:
Came here early on a Saturday evening to grab a bite to eat. The man at the front desk was SO friendly. He quickly put together two small tables for us and we were on our way to enjoying some tasty food! 

We ordered drinks and they came out quick. My gin drink was fresh and tasty. I have to say though, I think the drinks at Devil's Acre were better but these were quite good, too! One complaint would be there were only 2 beers on tap which was kind of odd to me! Our appetizer of their potatoes were AMAZING. So tasty! I loved my kale salad. Husband loved his burger and fries. OMG, their fries are DELICIOUS! 

I loved that everything came out quick and the service was on it. We were checked on plenty of times and well taken care of. Also the decor of this place is really awesome. 

I would come back to Comstock Saloon anytime!
author: Kelli H.

description:
Love this place!

Loved the decor, ambiance, service, food, cocktails..you get the point.

It was such a well done build out - when we first walked in we thought it was this cute, quaint little place, but then started to wander and found the back bar and seating area with the live band. 

The cocktails and food were great, and not horribly priced. We had planned on going to a few venues during the evening, but ended up spending the whole evening there - because of the bar staff and the quality of cocktails. We mentioned what we preferred or didn't for that matter to the bartender, and requested that he pair cocktails and snacks till closing time - and he did the job beautifully.

If you're in town and looking for a great low key, elegant, and fun place, I'd definitely recommend Comstock!
author: Priya P.

description: This cocktail bar is a great! The bar is a century old and includes the original wood bar top. The details of the bar are certainly something to look at while you're sipping on your drink. As a collector of vintage glassware, I appreciated that they served each drink in something vintage. Go with the bartender's recommendation on one of their signature drinks or give him a challenge to whip you something up!
author: Alexandra G.

description:
Great if at times over busy saloon right on columbus avenue located right at the intersection of pacific and columbus. That's a very interesting block to explore, right at the junction of chinatown and the Financial District.

Parking is street only which means there is no parking. Like most things in this area you are best served by getting here in some way that does not involve driving, but if needs must, there's a parking garage not too far away. 

This is one of the more historical saloons in the area having housed the San Francisco Brewing Company right after the big one in 1906. It retains sections of the original bar counter and the architecture is clearly from another century.

The splendid bar offers counter seating for about a dozen or so, and there are some small barstool/table combos here and there for those that want (slightly) more privacy. One of the oddities is that this bar has two completely different entrances with slightly different physically separated sides to it. The difference is that one side has slightly better seating if you are coming here for more food then drink. The tap selection while small is decent. The wine list is offers much better choices then the beer, but the cocktails are where the action is at here. The happy hour is fairly epic, offering decent pricing on high quality items-house cocktails, select wines, beers/shot combos (the shot is served in a tiny glass boot.) and bar snacks. The menu is any too deep, but offers decent pairing for wine/beer snacking. Pricing is in the mid to high range a drink or tow and a light plate will hit you for about 20 bucks, more if you go the premium cocktail route.

This as you can imagine  is a popular spot and at peak times-happy hour, friday/saturday nights it'll be standing room only. The potential for wait times for a table is present at peak times, so some planning ahead might be in order.

Overall a nearly perfect place for social drinking with great small plate options.
author: Steven W.

description:
Final bar hopping stop on Friday, May 8th around 10:45pm.

Drinks:
*Pisco punch: pisco, pineapple gum, lime ($12)
*Blood & sand: scotch, sweet vermouth, orange, cherry liqueur ($11)
*Barkeep's whimsy: let the barkeep decide your fancy ($12)

I was basically done drinking by the time we got here, so I just ordered a Pisco punch. It was tart and light which was exactly what I needed. A nice sipping drink to end the night. My girlfriend ordered the Barkeep's whimsy. They did a great job making the flavors she wanted come to life in a cocktail.

Food:
*Pobrecitos: mini oyster po' boys with chips ($15)
*Bucket of shrimp: cocktail sauce, lemon ($15)

Since we were here, we decided to order a couple dishes even though we had already had dinner. The bucket of shrimp is good. Can't really go wrong with shrimp and cocktail sauce. The pobrecitos were okay. I thought the batter was too crunchy for the delicate oysters. But I loved the chips that came with it. Like spicy barbecue chips. So good! I would order a huge side of just the chips if I could.

I'd love to come back and explore their drink menu more. Since we ended the night here, I just nursed my last drink. And of course, I'll see if they can just give me a side of spicy barbecue chips! Yum!
author: Elena N.

description: Great bartender and staff! went last sunday and found a table right away.Good Manhattans
author: Luther S.

description:
We came in on a Saturday night for post-dinner drinks. Our service slapped the menus down and asked if we were eating dinner. We were initially taken aback - maybe his introduction was unintentional? and decided to stay for a round to check it out. We sat by the window to people watch although there was a live band in the second room of the bar. After a Negroni (which my husband said was delicious) and my glass of Cabernet, we decided to move elsewhere. The major downfall was the long wait and awkward nods to get our server to bring our tab.

Pros: Good drinks. Great location for people watching.
Cons: Service needed some work. Wasn't their A-game night.
author: Torie M.

description:
There's only one thing I hate more than jazz music and that's live jazz music... and guess what? They've got that here. 

Or at least they did when my party of 5 came a few Saturdays ago for dinner. 

To be honest, my time at Comstock was probably the first time I wasn't totally annoyed by having to hear jazz music while I'm doing something that I otherwise love (eating + drinking). The really good news was that the band is located on the second level of the place so they're out of site and because the place is already so loud, you can barely hear anything to be distracted by. With that, I will give them props that for a jazz hater like myself, this was the least offensive jazz music I've been acquainted with probably ever. 

What I did find to be turn off was that after the band stopped playing (which might as well have just been from someone's ipod since you can't see them from the lower level we were seated and it's fairly hard to hear with the general saloon noise and all), someone from the band went around to every table and seat with a jar to basically panhandle for tips as we ate our meal. It was strange and kind awkward and with a place as small as Comstock is, seems odd to even allow that because how much are they really going to collect in return for interrupting diners and just generally being uncomfortable. 

I don't know how often this occurrence is, so I'm going to give the benefit of doubt and go with an over-star rating because the service, atmosphere, and food otherwise were very good. 

I loved my wine and I got to try my first bourbon-soaked cherry. The menu was super San Francisco, with not a huge number of options, high-quality ingredients and more than casually priced dishes. 

I'd chowed down on some dive bar cheese and Ritz crackers as my pre-game so I wasn't super hungry, but did order the 'bucket of shrimp', which was exactly that- a big bucket full of ice chips with 6 shrimps hanging over the edge accompanied by 2 lemon slices and a side of cocktail sauce. It was shrimp - nothing much to report there. It was exactly as I ordered though I kind of wished I'd put the $15 that the shrimp bucket cost towards a real meal because the stuff my dining partners got looked far heartier and flavorful, further proving that all my regrets in life are food based. 

I'd love to come back on a regular, non-jazz weeknight for a drink and perhaps some food that doesn't come in a bucket for my next trip because I think they might def have it going on here.
author: Candice G.

description:
Pisco punch was refreshing for a warm, sunny day.  

A shot in a mini, boot-legged glass with a pint of beer for happy hour and Saint Patty's day!  Cheers to that. 

Lovin' the vibe and speakeasy vibes here. 

Drinks with top notch bar bites for the win!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
As the last stop on our North Beach bar crawl, I would've been sitting in a cardboard box with a blissful smile on my face. Luckily, we were enticed by the wall art outside Comstock Saloon and wandered in here instead. 
The craft cocktails here are creative, strong, and made without pretension: the holy trinity of craft cocktails. If you're in a more traditional mood, the Manhattan here is also incredible. 
I loved the saloon atmosphere, and we sat right in front. Make sure to check out the aptly-themed and eclectic books on the shelf by the bar!
author: Delaynie K.

description: Amazing meal! The lamb pasta is incredible. The ambiance is super fun, with live music on Mondays and Fridays. And the fries with Miller's ranch were very tasty.
author: Zoë P.

description: The dude bartender was whatever. Threw the menus down on our tables. Mind you, it was a weeknight. Not busy at all, which makes it not okay. The drinks were OK. Definitely will hit you at the very end. The only complaint I have about this place is that it charges you SF tax and food tax. But all we had were drinks at the bar! They really should separate the bar and restaurant. Two drinks BEFORE tipping was $27. Eh.
author: Annie S.

description:
Rustic, old fashion bar at the corner between the neighborhoods of North Beach and Chinatown. They have wooden booths and ceiling fans. Very dim but very cozy. I was here earlier in the day around 5pm, no crowd. The services was nice and the drink were decent. Happy Hour everyday!

I actually like the bar. Not sure if its because the cozy atmosphere or because I had a very good first date here. haha! Overall nice bar to hang out with your friends or for a first date.
author: Sandy B.

description: Great place for an impromptu happy hour on a Saturday, great vibe right on the border of FiDi and North Beach, with classy bartenders and creative cocktails.  Could use a few more drinks for happy hour, they just have one.  We had a big group and they were very accommodating to move more tables and chairs for us, except the tab, we had one tab, 20 people, we all know how those turn out, plus a lot of us didn't have cash so had to walk over to an ATM.  I would think a place like this can just handle credit cards.
author: Inga W.

description:
Comstock Saloon is a jazzy little place with classy feel. The wooden booths and cool cieling fans give this place a little bit of character. The bartenders spend time mixing the drinks so you will not be disappointed. A great spot for an after work hangout or a late night drink.

A little secret: Monday - Friday (11:30am - 2:30pm) Comstock offers a meal on the house with the purchase of two full-priced drinks. Last time I went we got "Toad in the Hole" with my drink purchase.
author: Aletta B.

description: Hands down my favorite place to come for a manhattan. Consistently amazing service. The brussels sprouts changed my life. Always a good experience. Pro-tip: call ahead for a table as they take reservations and it always gets crowded.
author: Ariana R.

description:
A coworker and I headed to the Comstock Saloon after a conference one night. We were able to find seats at the bar and I was immediately impressed by the historical decor. It felt like we were in an old gold rush town.

The bartender turned out to be one of the owners and he was really friendly as he told us the history of the bar. My coworker has many food allergies and she ended up making a very complicated order out of something that should have been straight forward. The bartender took it in stride and never made her feel like an inconvenience. He also had great suggestions on drinks, each of which was delicious.

I highly recommend sitting at the bar if you make it the Comstock Saloon.
author: Casey S.

description:
I like this place . The service is always superb.. 
I like the happy hour from 4 till 6. 
The shots and beer around 7$
Parking is no issue 
I cannot wait till next time !
author: Fernando B.

description:
When out of town visitors ask, "Where should I go for a good drink?", Comstock Saloon is near the top of the list. A classic, boozy good time.

When in doubt, order the special daily drink written on the chalkboard. It might be a little funky, but it's generally tasty. Bartenders here know what they're doing.

Another great think about Comstock? Kitchen stays open late! I've had many an oysters and sparkling wine experience past 10 pm, aka "late" by SF standards.

Not much else to say besides grab a booth, order as much alcohol as you can handle and make this your watering hole for the evening.
author: Abby S.

description: Very cool, old bar right in the heart of Columbus.  The service was great, the drinks were well done but the star of the show is the décor.  It feels like stepping into a saloon in 1890.
author: Mike D.

description: Always a delight! Live music  and wonderful drinks. Great low key place to check out and hang with friends.
author: Mary N.

description:
What a great joint,  the feel / vibe is classic ol'd school,  but hipster all rapped up in a beautiful blanket! !!, it's warm and inviting. The bartender (chris) seems to be very friendly and welcoming. He even had his coworker Michael run out and pick up some smokes for some other patrons at the bar.  I ordered a Bullitt rye Manhattan over.. A+. 
Customer service is a extremely demanding job, and these guys delivered.  Txs
author: Séamus C.

description:
For a Saturday evening, this place had quite a few people. We walked in on one side, but there weren't enough the seats there. There was 2 sides to the bar, and the other side had a few more seats. 

I ended up getting the pisco punch which was actually pretty good. I will admit this was the first drink of many that night, but the atmosphere at this bar was almost there. I kind of wanted it to be a little more saloon like, but it was great nonetheless. 

Overall, good strong drinks and great time with the boyfriend.

Pro tip: check both sides of the bar, there's definitely some space. More than you might think.
author: Nina Y.

description:
The bartender that night was just okay, but the pastry chef did a primo job.


---- COCKTAILS ----

South Side Cocktail: 3.5 stars
Made with Hendrick's gin, this is pretty good.

Barkeep's Whimsy: 4 stars
I asked for an elderflower drink, unfortunately he made it with normal gin and I only like Hendrick's.


---- FOOD ----

Kale Salad with Enoki Mushroom: 1 star
Super sour dressing, I felt like raw lemon juice

Gnocchi: 4.5 stars

Lamb Meatballs: 3.5 stars


---- DESSERT ----

Hazelnut Chocolate Mousse: 5 stars
Perfection.  My partner tried to sneak all of this for himself.  The rich creamy mousse came with little crunchy bits of candied hazelnuts in it to balance the texture.

Bourbon Caramel Pudding: 4 stars
This was a glass of pudding and banana cake...  very sugary.
author: Letitia L.

description: The food is good. The drinks are solid - but there are one or two bartenders w/a bit too much attitude for me. When I go, it's because "out of towners" are looking for a "solid SF experience in NoBe" or we're already in the area. To be clear - you're sure to have a great time if you're focus is strictly on the group of people with whom you're hanging out. Do not go to Comstock Saloon expecting to engage w/friendly 'bartenders/mixologists'.
author: Nick S.

description:
Yeeeee-haw! What a neat little wild west hitching post! Here are a few reasons to pony up to Comstock:

The music:  I sat at the bar while waiting for my buddy to join me for happy hour.  I rocked out to Phish and Pink Floyd.  Yes!!! I loved it

The bartender:  friendly, professional, and a character that completely fit the bar's theme

Drink menu:  there's plenty of everything that's sure to please any palate.  Sure enough, Comstock can hang with SF's best handcrafted cocktail menus

The pickle plate:  yes, that is a pickled grape on there!  Just go for it-- it's oddly delicious
author: Andrea H.

description: Not the best. I ordered a drink and the bartender rolled her eyes at me. Then the hostess rolled his eyes at me for saying I was also Canadian.
author: Natalie G.

description:
This review is just for the drinks--and the awesome HISTORY of this place.

First off, they make an exceptional Manhattan. I order Manhattans like I order Diet Cokes: with pretty much every meal I have. Thus, if I say they make one of the best I've ever tasted, I'm not exaggerating. On the other hand, their Happy Hour special at this time--the Holland House--was only OK. Told it was 'citrus-y,' I didn't quite except the lemon to smack me in the jaw and override the gin entirely. Next time I'll try their famed Cherry Bounce--apparently listed "one of the 50 best cocktails to try before you die." Considering the fact that a Cocktail Quest is pretty much exactly what I would seek to accomplish were I to know my specific expiration date, I appreciate this.

Now for the special stuff: This saloon was started way back in 1907 (and the building itself housed the second oldest bar in San Francisco). It was named for Henry Comstock of the famed Comstock silver lode in Nevada. The space is extremely cool-looking, very frontier-chic, and one can imagine oneself in Edwardian shirtwaists or boating hats, sitting at the dark wooden bar under the framed 19th century illustrations and watching the horses and carriages clatter by. The effect is enhanced by the hipsters who frequent this place: their beards and waxed mustaches, their suspenders, bowler hats, and watch chains, and their adorable bobbed-hair, red-lipsticked girlfriends in their high-buttoned Mary Poppins shoes make you want to order a Sazerac, unfold the newspaper, rave about the Queen and bitch about the Kaiser.

I'll be back for the food, too. Free lunch Fridays!!
author: Ali M.

description:
Came here for lunch when we spotted it, and it seems to have good reviews. There was no bigger seats for party greater than 4, but we sat in a corner with the sofa and stove, which was quite an interesting experience. 

The lunch special deal of "ordering 2 drinks and gets a free lunch" totally stroked my group's drinking vibe and many of us ordered 2 drinks per person! The free lunch changes everyday (maybe), we had sausage with egg and hashbrown. The portion for the free lunch was smaller, more for settling the stomach for the drinks. I ordered the fat boy salad, which was refreshing and portion was big! 

The drinks were good and cool too! I ordered Bartender's Whim and described the flavor and taste as usual, but I got something that I never had from bars or speakeasy and the taste was really surprisingly good and refreshing!
author: Ya K.

description:
All I need to end a long evening of indulging to the point of excess is a seat in a Comstock Saloon booth. 

The din of drunken conversation will nearly obscure the excellent band playing out of the loft space above all our heads as sips of Blood & Sand gently and deliciously push me over the edge.

Luckily, the comestible menu is easily the equal of the cocktail menu. To soak up a bit too much booze, nothing beats a bite of a beautifully executed Andouille Scotch Egg, or perhaps the impossibly creamy and crisp squash fritters. 

Such high quality eats are more than a match for the shots of Fernet you're fed by friends. If you're anything like me, you'll wander out unsteadily but with fond memories, promising to return.
author: Peter D.

description: I have taken friends here several times and the knowledgable bar staff has nailed it every time. If you don't know what you want, you can tell them what you like and they will make a drink tailored to you. The food is solid as well.
author: J B.

description: We came here having heard good things, but what a disappointment. We had the bartender specials - 1 - Spirit forward (decent, nothing special) and the other we asked for a bit peaty (terrible- undrinkable) so we got an old fashioned to play it safe. It was undeniably the worst old fashioned ever made (and I love me an old fashioned)
author: Susan K.

description: I came here around 11:30pm and was refused a drink by one of the bartenders, Zack. He was unbelievably rude and forgot my friend's entire drink order. He may be having a bad day but I feel incredibly insulted and will never return to this establishment. If you want to have a good night out please do NOT come here.
author: Stephen D.

description:
This place was packed on a Friday night. We came around 10 and it seemed like people were still piling in. Anyhow, we lucked out and got a table for two. The host was kind enough to let us use a reserved table since that party wasn't there yet. Shout out to you kind sir. 

It's not on the menu, I don't think, but the Pimm's cup was fantastic. Large beer mug type of presentation that I appreciated. Also had the blood and sand cocktail that I would recommend.

The real treat for us at night was the fried green tomatoes with panchetta and some light greens. Lightly fried and tart, it made my drink seem better. Second shout out to our waitress for recommending it.

Also of note is that they have a live band playing music in an upstairs corridor. Wonderful touch there.
author: Quoc N.

description:
Lately, I've been on a roll with experience bad and slow service.  Comstock Saloon didn't help with this either.

I've been here several times.  Most of the time, they were just for drinks or happy hour.  I remember the first time I came (early 2012?), we had a really rude bartender that didn't make our drinks properly.  I was disappointed, but whatever.. maybe he was just having a bad day.

Second time I came, waited over 20 minutes to get a bartender's attention.  Again, not too happy about it.

And the third time... Well, this time, we went for dinner.  Luckily our friend made reservations.  But guess what?  We still had to wait!  The host was really friendly so our wait wasn't too unpleasant.  He mentioned that they allotted 3 hours for the previous table, but they were still sitting there!

Once we were seated, it took a good 20 minutes before our server came to our table for our drink order.  Just drinks!  At that point, we were starving.. our buzz was wearing off.. we wanted our food.  So we ordered.. and of course.. it took another 20-30 minutes for our food to arrive.

The food was great.  I had the roasted chicken (under a brick with tomato ragu, sautéed summer squash, parmesan breadcrumbs, basil).  This was perfectly cooked, juicy and succulent.  My friend had the duck pot pie with broccoli & plum-rhubarb mostarda.  This was a bit too heavy for me, so I wasn't really a fan.  We also ordered the mashed potato fritters, loaded 'tater dip as an appetizer.  Delicious!  The portions were also fairly large.

Some other mentionables:  
- Drinks are delicious
- Very prohibition/roaring 20s feel
- They have a live band that plays jazz music on Friday and Saturday nights
- Space is a little cramped.. not much room to move around
- Once again, really slow service.

Overall impression: Blah.
author: Cecilia S.

description:
One of the best bars in NorthBeach/Chinatown/near Fidi neighborhood. Great for HH.

- Beautiful antique wooden and wallpapered interior 
- Live jazz music 
- 2 Rooms. one with bar and cabin. Other room for drinks
- Best Happy Hour - $7 pimms cup!! 
- Drinks are well crafted and on strong side.  
- Have full food menu. Must haves - scotch egg, home made chips and sliders!
- Full bar with good cocktail/beer/wine menu
- Good service.
 - Tend to get crowded after office hours. So come early to grab a seat.
author: Payal B.

description: My new favorite bar. Love the live band on the weekends, they play up on a second floor balcony which is perfect. It's not too loud and its fun to see the band up top! The bar is stunning and I live how the bartenders and staff are dressed in that gold rush era style. Feels like a blast from the past, plus really innovative drinks. This is my favorite bar on the block, and there are many competitors. Service was awesome as well!
author: Kimia M.

description:
Comstock has a cool vibe, that smooth speakeasy charm but the food fell short of matching that ambience you feel when you walk in.

We had the scotch egg as a starter, and it was tasty.  Their version has some spicy andouille sausage between the soft egg and breaded crust, and it's a spicy and formidable starter.

We then split their house burger and it was completely forgettable.  Tasted like a backyard BBQ burger put on a nice plate, nothing beyond that.  

Cocktails were good, I had their popular Cherry Bounce and it was a well-balanced creation.  Their Blood & Sand I tasted was a bit weak, didn't come together well.
